intro: Margaritaria adelioides, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa, characterized by its thick, waxy leaves and yellow-orange sap. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in cyathia, typical of the spurge family. Its latex contains toxic compounds, which can cause skin irritation and is used in traditional medicine. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and adaptability to various soil types.
